Title: A Fortunate Decision That You Can Trust: Digital Twins as Enablers for the Next Generation of Energy Management Systems and Sophisticated Operator Assistance Systems
Authors: C. Brosinsky, M. Naglič, Sebastian Lehnhoff, Rainer Krebs, Dirk Westermann
Abstract summary: Digital twins can enable intelligent decision support systems and assistant functions to address the challenges of increased complexity in power system operation.

Title: Operation Orchestration of Local Energy Communities through Digital Twin: A Review on suitable Modeling and Simulation Approaches
Authors: T. Nguyen-Huu, T. Tran, Minh-Quan Tran, P. Nguyen, J. Slootweg
Abstract summary: Digital twins with suitable modeling and simulation techniques can enable operation orchestration of local energy communities to support distributed energy resource integration.

Title: Leveraging the Asset Administration Shell for Agent-Based Production Systems
Authors: Felix Ocker, Christoph Urban, B. Vogel‐Heuser, C. Diedrich
Abstract summary: The paper discusses how digital twins can be leveraged to create agent-based production systems, but does not mention operator support systems or DER management.

Title: On the Integration of Agents and Digital Twins in Healthcare
Authors: Angelo Croatti, Matteo Gabellini, Sara Montagna, A. Ricci
Abstract summary: This paper discusses the integration of agent-based digital twins in healthcare, but does not cover operator support systems or distributed energy resource management.

Title: Multi-Agent Systems in Support of Digital Twins: A Survey
Authors: Elena Pretel, Elena Navarro, Víctor López-Jaquero, Alejandro Moya, Pascual González
Venue: International Work-Conference on the Interplay Between Natural and Artificial Computation
Abstract summary: The paper discusses how multi-agent systems can support digital twins, but does not specifically address practical needs for operator support systems in DER management.

Title: Cloud-Edge Hosted Digital Twins for Coordinated Control of Distributed Energy Resources
Authors: Jiaxuan Han, Q. Hong, M. Syed, M. A. U. Khan, Guangya Yang, G. Burt, C. Booth
Abstract summary: Cloud-edge hosted digital twins enable coordinated control of distributed energy resources to improve grid support during contingencies.

Title: Moving Towards Distribution System Operators: Current Work and Future Directions
Authors: Josue Campos do Prado, W. Qiao, S. Thomas
Venue: IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Conference
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the evolution of distribution systems into distributed system platforms with Distribution System Operators, but does not mention agent-based digital twins for operator support.

Title: Digital Twin System Framework and Implementation for Grid-Integrated Electric Vehicles
Authors: Jeong-Un Yu, Kyu-Sang Cho, Sung-Won Park, Sung-Yong Son
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a digital twin-based framework for integrated operation of electric vehicles, charging stations, and the power grid.
